info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 9:05PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 904 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rain moving across Downtown Charleston and portions of Mount Pleasant. Localized amounts in excess of 1 inch have already fallen. An additional 1 to 2 inches could fall through 10 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, James Island, West Ashley, Sullivan`s Island, Fort Johnson, Patriots Point, Marion Square, Columbus Street Terminal, Ravenel Bridge, Mount Pleasant Waterfront Park, Medical University Of South Carolina, Remleys Point, The Old Village, The Citadel, Fort Moultrie and Saint Andrews.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Charleston will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Areas most prone to flooding include the Market, Crosstown, East Bay Street and Morrison Drive. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
